decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted has commenced within 3 years from the date of the original permission ref. 2020/0276 dated 22.03.2020. 
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.
Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed 055-PLP, 055-PL02, email dated 17/03/2020; P01 r, Noise Management Plan, 22.11.2021.  
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 3 - The use hereby permitted shall not be open to customers other than between the hours of:
(a) [08:30 - 18:30] Mondays - Fridays 
(b) [10:00 - 17:00] Saturdays 
(c) [10:00 - 16:00] Sundays & Bank Holidays
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) or any Order revoking, amending and re-enacting the Order the development hereby approved shall be used only as a Dog Grooming Salon and Dog Day Care Centre (Class E and Class Sui Generis) and for no other purpose. In addition, the use of the premises as a Dog Day Care Centre shall cease on 20/12/2022 and the use of the premises will revert to back to a Dog Grooming Salon as approved under planning reference 2020/0276 on that date unless a further application has been approved by the local planning authority. 
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood by ensuring that other uses which could cause a loss of amenity do not commence without prior approval in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Condition : 5 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the soundproofing scheme submitted and approved by the local planning authority under application ref. 2021/1622 dated 07.06.2021 and retained thereafter. Reason: To safeguard the amenities of residential occupiers, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the 
National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Condition : 6 - The premises shall not be used for the boarding or housing of animals at any time outside of the permitted hours of opening. 
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Condition : 7 - All rear facing windows and doors into the yard area within the premises shall remain closed at all times unless a door is being uses for access purposes.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Condition : 8 - A maximum of three dogs at any given time are permitted to use the rear yard and covered area during permitted hours. When using these areas the dogs shall remain under the direct supervision of staff members as stipulated within the submitted Noise Management Plan dated 22/11/2021. 
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Condition : 9 - No dogs shall be allowed to occupy the rear yard and covered area on Sundays and Bank Holidays.  
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Condition : 10 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application.  The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
description: Variation of conditions 4 and 6 of planning permission dated 22/03/2020 ref 2020/0276 (Alterations to existing shop front in connection with change of use from restaurant (Class A3) to dog grooming salon (part ClassA1, part Class Sui Generis).) to allow use as Dog Grooming Salon and Dog Day Care Centre (Class E and sui generis).
